topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/549875e86368724fc8ab0500#post_549875e86368724fc8ab0500
[bq="EHAN"]Our house has security cameras

The people who lived here before we did have three pretty young children, so I can see why they installed it then.

But of course our dad is gonna leave it up. And he can (and will) access the cameras from mobile devices, even when he is halfway across the world on business trips.

The one I'm most annoyed about is the one pointing at the game room. Where I rage over video games a lot. And he hates it when I do that.

[spoiler]So I will either have to control my temper for the next six or seven months before I go off to college (haha nope, as much as I want to I'm waaay too competitive to not rage), or not play at all so that I don't rage.[/spoiler]

On another note, FNaF has ruined me because now I can't see the camera screens without thinking of that. Add the fact that one of the cameras is busted too, and it's just uncanny.[/bq]

well atleast the cameras are not settled in the place where you masturbate 

hahahaha
topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5498784663687267fc6a0000#post_5498784663687267fc6a0000
I know the feel.

I don't mind camera's anywhere else but not in my home, when I'm home and alone I want to feel like I have my privacy.

Camera's even though their for security also make it really uncomfortable to feel, well, secure.

topics.body:
"@Twisty":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/549879026368721edee30400#post_549879026368721edee30400
[spoiler]No cameras in my bedroom THANK GOD[/spoiler]

"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/549879436368723801390200#post_549879436368723801390200
In public places like an airport or a restaurant, I can understand why cameras are needed, and they feel welcome there. But if you're putting cameras in your HOME, that's just not right. It's where you LIVE. That's kinda the reason why I hate people publicizing their private lives, like talking about family issues and stuff (and call me a hypocrite for talking about this), because it's THEIR lives and shouldn't be the business of anyone else. Even within families, a brother's life and a sister's life, for example, should not overlap 100% with one another. That just raises issues.
topics.author: 9ba2e84e636164642cc03200
